reviewText:
Interesting little RPG where while you play a dark knight, though it feels more like you are playing an evil mage.  You have abilities, which act more like spells, such as raising a pet skeleton to help you fight.  You don't really use your sword for swinging, but use it to cast disease at your enemies.  You have crowd control via the use of fear.  You suck rage from enraged monsters to do finishing blows.

This game feels very much like a 2D version of WoW in some ways, since you need to cycle through all these different abilities in order to killing everything.  You have quests to complete, where the UI feels very much like playing old Everquest than anything else.   You even hail people.

My only real complaint is that the mouse is a bit over used.  You (1) move with right-mouse button, (2) target with left-mouse button, and (3) select an ability also with left mouse button.  It would have been better to at least allow you to use WASD keys for movement, or to bind keys to the abilities.  As it is, it feels a little cumbesome to play.

Even so, the textual descriptions are fairly decent. While not being overly long, they have enough role-playing angst in trying to get your supposed fiancee to make them interesting enough to read.   The sound effects are pretty humorous, especially when you are strutting around in your clunky suit of armor.  It sounds like you are in desparate need of a can of oil.  I like the little pools of blood when enemies die.

Overall I would say while this game is a bit rough around the edges (such as sprites disappearing when moused over at times), it is charming enough for a few hours of play.

reviewText: Very enjoyable game with interesting 'rage' mechanics. Fights consist of exchanging spells, scaring enemies so that you can pick them off one at a time, taking advantage of their rage and unleashing it against them for mega damage. Very intelligent and original spin on the action rpg.
